Based on the user's preference cues, I would recommend "Aladdin" (1992) directed by Peter Jackson.

The movie revolves around Aladdin, a young prince living in an ancient kingdom ruled by his father, King Shahzan. 

One day, while wandering through a cave, he finds an oil lamp and accidentally strikes it, causing the lamp to ignite and casting a bright light into the cave. 

While struggling to extinguish the flame, he finds himself under the spell of the magical lamp. The lamp grants Aladdin three wishes. 

The first wish is for Aladdin's father to die. Aladdin knows that if his father were to die, Aladdin would become King Shahzan. This thought alone causes Aladdin to fall unconscious from shock. 

The second wish is for Aladdin's brother to be killed by an animal. Aladdin knows that if his brother were to be killed by an animal, then Aladdin would inherit the throne of the kingdom ruled by Aladdin's father. This thought alone causes Aladdin to fall unconscious from shock. 

The third wish is for Aladdin himself to turn into a young man once again. Aladdin knows that if he himself were to turn into a young man once again, then Aladdin himself would become King Shahzan. This thought alone causes Aladdin to fall unconscious from shock. 

While under the spell of the magical lamp, Aladdin finds himself in many different adventures throughout the kingdom. These adventures include winning at a royal tournament, stealing from a rich merchant's store, and even saving his own life by cleverly using various objects in the kingdom to help him escape from an enemy who was pursuing him with great speed through the kingdom. 

After several days of travel throughout the kingdom, Aladdin finally finds himself back in front of the magical lamp that he had previously wished upon to become a young man once again. 

Aladdin now realizes what happened during his wish upon the magical lamp. When Aladdin wished upon the magical lamp to become a young man once again, it caused an immense amount of magical energy to be released from within the magical lamp itself. This immense amount of magical energy was then released into the surrounding environment throughout the kingdom, causing an immense amount of magical energy to be released into the surrounding environment throughout the kingdom.
